comments.body: Yes good idea
Interesting. Please be more specific though.
@FatalAcacia thank you and please tell me what I should be more specific on

So I was thinking that it shouldn't be just iron, gold could also be an option, and how would it generate? Adjacent to caves, or randomly, like a dungeon? Would some materials be biome specific, and should it generate with both blast and normal furnaces?

It could be a rare but huge complex like the woodland mansions (but more abandoned) with smithing tables, blast furnaces, Bluefire furnaces (structures rather than blocks), anvils, barrels of weapon-loot, chests full of material loot, (like ingots and ores) regular furnaces, armor stands, stone cutters, fletching tables, crafting tables, lava pools and artificial lava falls.

It might also have sleeping rooms and kitchens, or those could be separate but connected structures.
The End is NOT boring!  If you think it is, play on hard.
Hmm I never thought of that, thanks for your suggestion. It's just boring in a exploration way as I like to go on adventures.
@bilbo baggins you can not deny the lack of content there. After you have your elytra and shulker shells you have no reason to go back
What if you want more shulker shells or elytra?
There's Phantom membrane to repair you elytra. Also just going for End Cities I would think there would need to be more to the End than there is now.
I actually have wanted something like this for a while, so this is amazing! thumbs up.
There should be a mob that only spawns in the ruins. Maybe dark shulkers. They could be like normal but deal more damage.
Rebuilding the ruins to their imagined former glory would both be a fun and challenging task!
In these Ruins, you could find books, pieces of lost history and architecture.
This idea Is pretty good. Petrified Wood would be cool and the fact that it could be in ruins, love it! Keep up the good work with ideas!
so wait is this like "abandoned city biome" ?
Run i
It would generate on beaches and stretch out into the ocean. Also, the original category was a mistake and has been updated to the structure category.
Mossy logs would be perfect for the new mangrove biome

I like the idea of this but what if they had summing like a shulker box instead of the elytra so that player will still go for it because I probably would not do in for the normal loot if there was no elytra but I would  take a shulker box every day of the week. like y not ?
Plz it may have been a while ago that, that was a thing but it was still cool

Zamek jest dobrym spown pointem
I miss the castle so much and it %100 needs to be added back for 1.17 update

good idea but recently i learned that nether wart appears in some bastions you know there different form each other whilst a good idea I think a giant piglin skeleton with gold and  nether wort would be cool

piglin bastions also give netherwart, so they're already not limited to only fortresses. But if the point is to make netherwart easier to get, I feel like being able to break up Wart Blocks into individual warts would be more intuitive.

I do agree tho there should be some new structures the Nether really only has two types, idk what kind of structures though, or at least update the Nether Fortress to use some new blocks/look better.
I had an idea for a nether structure, I made a post about it, still might need approval though.
I wouldn't have them actually take them anywhere, but they could walk off in the distance and then despawn
this idea reminds me of those stories about how ancient structures like Stonehenge or the Aztec pyramids were used by people long ago to study the stars, sounds cool

they could have a treasure chest with a chance of the telescope spawning in it, and maybe a journal of discoveries that these people had in the form of a signed book and quill, or better yet if each structure had variants of journals and maybe some thing new to the game that comes in pieces and each structure only has one piece at random and you need all the pieces to make it. I was thinking it could be the result of their studies. I'm looking for ideas on what this should be should be.
Sounds not sounts

I think it could be cool if there were caves that could be filled with special slime ore and slimy blocks. A specific area for slime would be cool, as right now there isn't really any obvious lore on how the slimes are created.
I think it would be cool if there were underground structures in caves and such in the slime chunks, but also maybe the very rare slime statue on the surface made of stone or something
WhY tHIs nO iN gAMe
Love this! Finding cool stuff like this, these sorts of random flashes of life in what can sometimes feel like a very lonely place, is one of the things that I love about Minecraft
Its cool if it connects the theory of the existence of shipwrecks.

Could be worded better, but exactly what I had in mind.

...in fact, since I definitely want this to get more votes, can I help you reword it? Since I don't think one can reply to comments, I'll just give my suggestion:

Title: Ruined portals correspond with counterparts

Description: Ruined portals should generate with identical counterparts in the nether, at corresponding locations (and orientations). If you repair and activate a ruined portal, the frame of the corresponding portal is repaired and activated.

Also, similar to how Ruined Portals in the Overworld have nether terrain generated around it, Ruined Portals should have overworld terrain generated around them, allowing for a chance to find Overworld materials as well as know where they connect to.
Warped fungus should also be a common loot for ruined portal chests, allowing players to easily get a strider.
In addition, when you build a portal, the one made on the other side should be the same size/shape.

i think that they should be structures generated in the nether, they would be more common than nether fortress, and they have a blaze spawner in them, making us able to get blaze powder whitout having to find a nether fortress, as they're dumbely rare
sounds veeery laggy

This would be a mumbo jumbo level of lag...

my laptop would fail.

they need to improve the handling of lag even more if this is to happen.
How would structures built on/in the path of these icebergs handle movement?
perhaps the ice could freeze and melt rather than actually move? that way it would go right through structures. maybe it could even add an icey variant of prismarine and related items/mobs
Yes, it could be sort of cult like as well.
A fleshy, gross cave overflowing with zombies. Gross, but I love it. I just don't think this would fit the overworld. Perfect for the Nether!
I still dont say how a rotten flesh block makes rotten flesh any more useful

A rotten flesh block would make for better storage of an item most people have in abundance. It would also just be a gross block that would be fun to have—should have a sound similar to honey or slime when you place it. It could be used to feed wolves, cats, pigs, and players—it could be sort of like cake except it could also be eaten by mobs, that way you could leave food out for your pets, instead of just feeding them by right clicking. Just some ideas, but I think a rotten flesh block would be awesome.
My thoughts exactly! Might repel other over-world mobs because of it's horrid smell? That Idea was given to me by a friend lol.

I don't like the part about the Wither spawning there. I get what you're saying, but that will make the Nether impossibly hard. You'd be walking around, minding your own business, just wanting to get some blaze rods or nether quartz, and end up being chased by 6-7 withers at once... not fun at all.

Not sure about that wither part! The wither is a creature the player has to summon, and he makes you get something rare, a Nether Star. The only way to get a wither should stay as is, and you have to work a lot to get the powerful tool: the Beacon.

  1. Get Obsidian for your Nether Portal.
  2. Enter the Nether
  3. Kill a lot of Wither Skeletons to get 3 Wither Skulls;
This is the longest run-on sentence.  But that’s irrelevant.  There do not need to be any more bosses in Minecraft.
Bilbo you are wrong, we need many more bosses, the dragon and elder guardian are boring and it's easy to make the wither kill itself.

My idea is to make certain enchantments be available exclusively on certain structures, and some common powerful enchantments be available as a highest tier trade.

For structure specific ones

  • Igloos: Frost Walker.
  • Jungle Temple: Infinity
  • Nether Fortress: Fire Protection
  • Pillager Outposts: Crossbow exclusive enchantments
  • Ocean Ruins, Shipwrecks, Buried Treasure: Trident exclusive enchantments

Highest Tier exclusive trades

  • Mending
  • Unbreaking

Then the rest are part of the regular trade cycles.
Can you put a little more info?
I like that mabby thay can be villages for drowns to live in whare you can fight mabby to get an item
Amazing idea
Wow!! I would have never thought of this!!! This is AMAZING!!! Take all the votes you need!!!

It's interesting, the Horadric Cube reminds me. But something unique is missing. At this point, the player will already have good equipment and will not have problems with enchantments. Perhaps there may be some kind of change in the appearance of objects or properties uncharacteristic for enchantments. For example, an item can be thrown like a boomerang, or the item will heal you, losing durability, or when you receive some effect, it will apply another. That is, the item will receive some unique property, but only one.
I like your idea
Perhaps something new to be found in End cities? I think that could work.
